result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley John Barnum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
5 days credit if revoked.
Concurrent with: with Eau Claire County Case No. 14CF107

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to set up a payment plan within thirty (30) days with Probation Agent.  $3,275.05 represents Restitution plus a surcharge of $327.51.
Pursuant to an Order (DOC-31) dated July 25, 2014, $3,337.07 represents Restitution plus a surcharge of $333.71

Defendant to set up payment plan within thirty (30) days with Probation Agent. Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $10 represents the mandatory statutory surcharge for 943 property crimes.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, except as incidental to employment.    Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs or any prescription drugs not prescribed.    Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   No contact with:  Jacob Berg, Gold Star Mini Storage, Mark Burkart, Kevin Thompson and Lakd Wissota Storage.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for work release.  May be served in Eau Claire County if at no cost to Chippewa County.
Concurrent with: with Eau Claire County Case No. 14CF107
